Description: Fragment of rim and floor of East Greek black-figured pottery plate, with upturned rim. Rim glazed; to its inside broken maeander frieze and broad band with added red and white lines; on floor, black-figure animal frieze to left, tail of bird or siren followed by front part of sphinx; much added red and incised rosettes as fill.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.792)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: E173 (Previous Accession Number in Philadelphia, University Museum)
